captions.text: Okay, the first question is.
What do you think about...
What do you think about gay sex?
Gay what?
About what?
Gay sex.

You have to speak up. I'm old and don't hear
so well.
Gay sex.
Gay sex?
I didn't understand that second word.
Sex.

What do I think about it? Well, I think it's
wonderful.
Gay sex? I haven't had it in years.
I love it.

In what context? I think it's great, you know?
It's like the best though.

I'd rather do it then think about. For one
thing.
Oh, I think it's fantastic.
I love it.

I support whatever you want to do. Whatever
floats your boat.

I love it all the time. Morning, noon and
night.
I would have nothing else, but gay sex.

The favorite part was cum, cum, cum, cum,
cum.
Squishy warm sex, yes.

Bring it on. I'm waiting for it. Even though
i'm a senior.
And how do you identify?
I identify as an LGBTC sometimes F and Q.
How do I identify? Old.

You didn't ask, but i'll be 84 in a couple
of months.
I'll be 83 next month.
Do I know what the F stands for?
My age? I'm 86 or 85. Put 85.
Flexibility.

I know when I was young, I was chasing after
all the little dikes around.

And, do you feel that there are any misconceptions
about seniors and sex?

I think probably younger people figure that
seniors don't do it.

I think many people are going to find that's
untrue.
We know we have sex.
I've heard that much, I am.
Don't be fooled by the grey hair.
Dog face down is a good position.

I'm not dead yet. You know, I'll probably
be sexual til the day I die.
But, the missionary position is good too.
Maybe after I don't know.

You can have really wonderful experiences
in life being a slut.
Maybe I haven't experienced all positions.

Well, you're still young. You have plenty
of time.
Anything else you want to add about gay sex?

Have it. A lot of it. It's a wonderful thing.
Enjoy it while you can.
I'm blushing too but you can't see it.
There's nothing wrong with being a slut.
I still want more.

title: What Old People Think About Gay Sex.

comments.text:
What a brilliant video...initially, it cleverly played into the mindset we 
have of older people ie "oh they didnt get the question or they misheard 
it" before they tell with relish their sexploits :) Talk about making us 
look at our perceptions!

I love seeing older people with young spirits. Society has the knack of 
downplaying older people and their emotions. One of the best memories in 
nursing was when I was showering an older lady, with stunning white hair. 
She told me she missed her husband passionately and how they still had big 
hugs and long kisses. It was one of the most beautiful things I had heard. 
I love it when the ageist stereotypes are shattered like this :)﻿
